page.title: 19STOWE POOL LICHFIELD
page.content: {Stowe Pool},originally part of the Bishop's Manorial rights,was later used as a reservoir and supplied Lichfield with some of its water.Now it provides opportunities for leisure activities. There is a sailing club that uses the pool for most of the year.The boats are mainly "Mirror" and "Topper" dinghies.A small club house at the side of the pool houses an inflatable rescue boat. Sailboards are also becoming very popular. Fishing,by licence,is permitted in certain seasons of the year.Perch,Roach and Pike are the most common fish. Swimming is not permitted as the pool is 17ft deep in the middle. Swans visit the pool but do not nest there.There are usually some Mallard ducks on the pool and an occasional Canada goose.
